channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Business occupying pavement with bins, 21st September
item.description:
Could please the council ask the business to stop occupying public pavement with their bins for days. They obstruct the passage to wheelchair users and to buggies. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton High Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement impassable due to overgrown shrubs and bushes, 21st September
item.description:
It is not possible to use this pavement due to bushes and shrubs that are overhanging the wall. The pavement itself is also in a bad state due to weeds and cracking. This has been an issue for a few months. This present particular issues for those with mobility issues, especially on refuse collection days when the pavement on the other side of the road is impassable due to bins and refuse. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maidenstone Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The metropolitan police safer neighborhood CPSO offices free males CPSO Marcus mills CE 7195/CPSO Tyrese Thomas CE 718/CPSO Steven Fonseca Alba sitting on public bench in mabley park On 13/09/25 from 12:15pm - 13:30pm sitting on public bench for an hour and 15 minutes doing no policing work in the area or estates allowing criminals to crack on and get away with crimes why they sit on public benches getting paid for it. Taxpayers money well spent and wasted. Maybe these offices have been trained to sit on benches all day from their superiors. They also was a dangerous dog/k9 in the park at the time when cpso officers were sitting on bench. Owner of the dangerous k9 did not let his dog off the lead because of the police presence they just said hello and laughed and joked then when to another public park where the police would not see them letting their dangerous Dog off lead. Great police officers marvelous carry on with the good work. I could not join the police and sit on a bent all day doing nothing for the community this is disgusting from your local policing team. Metropolitan police commissioner. Sergeant Terry Hughes . Please address your offices and nip this lazy behavior in the butt., 21st September
item.description:
The metropolitan police safer neighborhood CPSO offices free males CPSO Marcus mills CE 7195/CPSO Tyrese Thomas CE 718/CPSO Steven Fonseca Alba sitting on public bench in mabley park On 13/09/25 from 12:15pm - 13:30pm sitting on public bench for an hour

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Row, Hackney, London

item.title: Antisocial behavior criminal activity On 03/09/24 at 23:35pm pretense victims, fraudulent insurance scam live at 3 Lavington Cl, London E9 5HF.There was a arson attack on a Irish travellers vehicle parked in lavington close car park bay L57.Two Irish white males early 20s set fire to this blue ford GJ20 KLD vehicle with a petrol can pouring flammable liquid down the side of the driver's side door then igniting car inflames.Two Irish males fled the scene running off after arson attack which has been planned and pre-meditated for a fraudulent insurance claim. Homerton fire brigade department attended scene and put fire out on vehicle. Firefighter stated the fire had been started,caused deliberately. Firefighter reported incident to metropolitan police to attend for investigation.Territorial police group unit 334 attended levington close registration vehicle number BX69 FNJ.where they found a group of Irish males early 20s hanging around in a uninsured vehicle untaxed no MOT sees the vehicle and arrested the driver. This whole event caused distress and disturbance to surrounding neighbours. Police officers did not contain the Irish group who were causing loud noise and nuisance as they were present. Public order offences wise police are around not doing their duty. Police were knocking on resident Door early hours in the morning asking if they've seen anything. Police looking for possible evidence and CCTV. An arson attack is the criminal and malicious act of intentionally starting a fire to damage or destroy property, which can include buildings, vehicles, or even forests. This act causes criminal damage, with potential consequences ranging from significant financial losses and injury to homelessness, or even death. Arsonists often use accelerants like petrol and may have motives such as vandalism, insurance fraud, or revenge, though some individuals may have impulse control disorders or pyromania.Residents are seriously concerned with incident of premeditated fire arson attack on a car has caused fear & distress to surrounding neighbours. Residents are in fear if these two Irish males are capable of doing this imagine it was somebody's home or the car fire escalated to burning someone's home. This needs to be taken seriously an investigated. Hackney Council and authority need to do their duty to safeguard Residence and members of public this is not on. The mayor of Hackney. The metropolitan police commissioner. Get your act together and serve the community., 21st September
item.description:
What is the sergeant of the borough hackney doing about this behavior. Sitting on benches all day with his colleagues.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Homerton Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request for Removal of UK Flags from Elmer's End Green - Concerns Regarding Far-Right Association, 21st September
item.description:
Dear Bromley Councillors and Officers, I am writing to express my serious concerns regarding the prominent display of numerous UK flags on the roundabout at Elmer's End Green, BR3 4AJ, close to my home. While national symbols can be displayed with patriotic intent, I am increasingly concerned about the potential for these displays to be co-opted by far-right groups, leading to a divisive atmosphere in our community. My concerns are not speculative. Online discourse and research from organizations monitoring extremism confirm that national flags are being appropriated as symbols by far-right groups to foster exclusionary nationalism and intimidate minority communities. This association, whether intended by the original display or not, can create an environment where certain residents feel unwelcome. The continuous display of these flags risks inadvertently sending a message that aligns with or tacitly endorses far-right sentiments. Our community is diverse and our public spaces must reflect these values. The presence of these flags has the potential to undermine the Council’s vital efforts to promote community cohesion and inclusivity. I urge the Council to take swift action to remove the flags. This action would send a clear message that our Council is committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all residents and that it is actively disassociating our public spaces from symbols exploited by extremist ideologies. I would be grateful for your prompt attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
